item.title: CS2 Match Decided By Coin Flip After Both Teams Forfeit
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/cs2-match-decided-by-coin-flip-after-both-teams-forfeit/

Both teams chose to forfeit in the middle of a professional Counter-Strike 2 match, letting the final map and the series itself be determined by a simple coin flip. Why? Because another qualifier scheduled for today has much higher stakes in the Valve Regional Standings.

‘ez win’

Earlier today, Ninjas in Pyjamas and Aurora faced off in a best-of-three as part of the CCT Season 2 Europe Series 18 Closed Qualifier. However, both CS2 teams wanted to compete in the BLAST Rising Europe open qualifiers later on, meaning the match would have to end after two maps for both teams to have time. Unfortunately for both NiP and Aurora, they split the first two maps, and with their BLAST Rising qualifier matches starting soon, both teams chose to forfeit.

Following the third map, caster Charlie “Cmd64” Drudge explained that Aurora had forfeited the map due to scheduling. However, the official NiP account on X stated that both teams had actually forfeited, but NiP had won the coin toss.

The decision to skip the rest of the CCT match in favor of the BLAST Rising qualifier actually panned out for NiP. The Ninjas won the Nordic Open Qualifier, earning a guaranteed spot in the closed qualifier that begins tomorrow. Unfortunately for Aurora, they didn’t just lose the coin toss, as they were eliminated in the semifinal of their BLAST Rising open qualifier.

Both teams consider the risk worth the reward. The closed qualifiers for BLAST Rising are events ranked by the Valve Regional Standings, and making it past qualifiers would be very rewarding to a team’s ranking. Format is the big difference maker. The CCT closed qualifier is also ranked, but it uses a group stage format, so one loss won’t immediately eliminate a team like Aurora. However the BLAST Rising open qualifier is a single-elimination bracket, so missing your match would result in instant elimination.

Do you think we’ll see this happen more this year in CS2? Let us know what you think down below or in the official Insider Gaming forums.

Check out more of the latest esports news, and don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Just Cause Movie Adaptation Will Be Written By Jack Ryan’s Writer
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/just-cause-movie-adaptation-will-be-written-by-jack-ryans-writer/

According to a new report, the Just Cause movie adaptation has secured Jack Ryan’s writer.

Operation Just Cause Will be Written by Aaron Rabin

The Wrap has learned that Aaron Rabin from Tom Clancy’s Jack Ryan, Silent River and more will be penning down Just Cause’s movie adaptation. It was also confirmed that Ángel Manuel Soto, the man behind Blue Beetle and Amazon’s upcoming The Wrecking Crew, will be directing the film.

Moreover, the report also states that the upcoming movie’s title has been decided, and they call it “Operation Just Cause.” It is inspired by the “real-life United States invasion of Panama”. The release window, cast, and plot details were not revealed. 

The initial announcement informed us about the producers for the Just Cause movie, which include Kelly McCormick and David Leitch from Fall Guy, Bullet Train and more, and they are represented through 87North’s first-look deal with Universal. Story Kitchen’s (also working on the Sleeping Dogs movie) Dmitri M. Johnson, Mike Goldberg and Timothy I. Stevenson, with Dan Jevons, will also serve as executive producers for the film; they are responsible for projects like Sonic the Hedgehog and Tomb Raider. 

Just Cause is a popular open-world action-adventure series developed by Square Enix that revolves around a formidable character called Rico Rodriguez. The series currently consists of four instalments, with Rodriguez causing mayhem in a new fictional country in each game. A key selling point of the franchise is its highly destructible environments, which reward players for creating chaos. Additionally, the series is known for its explosive action sequences.

In other news, Vision of Mana director Ryosuke Yoshida has joined Square Enix. Also, here are the nine classic titles from the Just Cause developer that are playable through Xbox. What are your thoughts on the Just Cause movie being written by Jack Ryan’s writer? Let us know in the comments or on our new community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Xbox Game Pass titles for February 2025. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: All Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 Achievements and How to Unlock Them (Guide)
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/all-kingdom-come-deliverance-2-achievements-guide/

Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 is a massive game, boasting two enormous maps, a lengthy story, and more side content than the average player can handle – but it’s so good. There’s so much meat on these bones, and anyone hunting for all the Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 achievements will be kept very busy.

In this guide, I’m breaking down all Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 trophies and achievements, so that you can hit the ground running with full expectations of what you need to do to unlock them all.

Read on for the full KCD2 achievement list.

Every Achievement in Kingdom Come Deliverance 2

Warning: Many of these achievements contain spoilers, so read ahead at your own risk.

You may need to complete more than one playthrough of Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 to unlock all the achievements. There are some seriously tough challenges on the list. Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum if you’re stuck on any KCD2 achievement or trophy and we might be able to help!

For more Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 content, find out how to complete Reckoning at the end of the game

item.title: How Long is Kingdom Come Deliverance 2? (Answered)
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/how-long-is-kingdom-come-deliverance-2-answered/

Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 is an enormous game in both scope and scale and from the maps you explore to the missions you complete, you’ll need to invest many hours in the game to conquer everything. That’s all well and good saying that, but what do the numbers look like? How long is Kingdom Come Deliverance 2?

In this guide, I’ll introduce you to the size of Kingdom Come Deliverance 2, breaking down just how long KCD2 is and how many hours it’ll take you to finish it.

How Many Hours is Kingdom Come Deliverance 2?

It took me 65.5 hours to complete the main story and a lot of side content in Kingdom Come Deliverance 2.

That includes many restarts and reloads following deaths and failed objectives. In those 65.5 hours, I managed to get to level 22, acquired some of the best weapons and armour in the game, and unlocked 50% of all the game’s achievements.

I didn’t unlock the achievement to ‘finish most of the game’s content’.

I also know that in those 65.5 hours, I left a lot of side missions untouched in my eagerness to get the game finished for a full review. However, you can go back and finish up skipped content once you’ve completed the game, so that’s my goal.

I believe that I left behind (or didn’t discover) enough content to push Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 to around 100 hours.

From mastering skills to uncovering secrets and from taking part in side activities to conquering secondary and tertiary quests, there is still so much for me to finish. I haven’t unfogged the entire map, I’ve not knocked all the nests out of the trees, and I haven’t visited every point of interest marked on my map.

If I speak frankly, I’d say that Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 is around 100 hours long for the average player. If you’re just rushing the story and not participating in side missions, you can probably complete the whole thing in around 20 – 30 hours without making any mistakes.

Are you surprised by how long Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 is? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum, and don’t forget to check out my full review of the game.

For more Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 content, check out where to find the best crossbow in the game
